text.p: Following are the main stories in Croatian newspapers on Tuesday.
- Displaced people to be awarded reconstruction loans of up to 44,000 kuna.
- The Vukovar hospital patients most probably among the victims of the Ovcara mass grave near Vukovar.
- It would be a good thing if Croatia were to become the monitor of cooperation in the Balkans, says in an interview Greek head of diplomacy, Theodoros Pangalos.
- Even dog breeds to be discussed in former Yugoslavia succession talks, claims Belgrade weekly NIN.
- The villagers of Bregana Pisarovinska not far from Zagreb report a UFO (Unidentified Flying Object) sighting on Sunday night just a day after the premiere showing of The X-files.

- The elections in Eastern Croatia to be held in line with Croatian laws, says in an interview Angolan lawyer Onofre dos Santos taking part in the final steps of the peace process in the region. -- Zagreb Newsroom, 385-1-4557075
